intro: Iberodes, commonly known as the Spanish heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and includes several species that are adapted to rocky and acidic soils. These plants typically have small, evergreen leaves and produce bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. They are often found in mountainous regions and are valued for their ornamental qualities. Iberodes species are also important in ecological studies due to their role in supporting local biodiversity.
